L7ylMnVGH4wtM7O3FsV1hQ.text: Food is good with fair variety but service is abysmally sloooowww.

FuUwp4YT6Rdea9ApIJSkWQ.text: Healthy, fresh, straightforward Turkish cuisine.Always busy.As for as I know It Runs by same person in same place.This year will be 34th year of Sofra Mayfair.

hS268eQxQAs1dhIo494w6g.text: Sofra food is simple and healthy, using a wealth of aromatic vegetables and a distinctive selection of herbs and spices. Blended with the traditional Turkish cuisine will be some exciting flavours from the Mediterranean, the Middle East and even the orient. This place is very clean and sevice is excellent, the food is to die for!!!

bRfziCQGzyKhKl-lPdyXeA.text: A really great restaurant serving some of the most delicious turkish food around. The mezze dish is my absolute favourite, but their deal of one main course and a glass of wine for £10 is tempting too.It's part of a chain, and this is a very welcoming branch

Xip2bjhc8ti24zVB7A7KOQ.text: A friendly place, good service, they got us a table even though we hadn't booked. Slightly touristy maybe (but we were there on a Friday night). Food is fine, but not outstandingly so. Starters could be a bit tastier, mains suffer from being served with boring greens (broccoli - I don't find that very Turkish!). But on the whole makes for pleasurable dining.

-tiN3hYmMgv-WvHIdIkB3A.text: Sofra is a decent chain and this is the best branch in my opinion. I find their menu doesnt caer for the winter very well - obviously the mezze are excellent all year round butnothing on the menu warms your sould when you see it on a cold day. I also find occassionally there a bit pushy with thing sthat the kitchen clearly wants to shift. But despite that it's good fun and the food is excellent most of the time. I think the best night to be in here was when Turkey beat Croatia at Euro 2008, I walked past whenthey won and it looked like the biggest party I've ever seen.

lEALYeXt20ZU1lgC1Zr0UQ.text: Sofra restaurants' are always top quality. The décor is basic but that doesn't matter as the food and service are always excellent. The food is Middle Eastern and has all the classics. Everything is cooked beautifully and the staff is always friendly and attentive. The price is reasonable too thus it is a great place to go back to when ever you are looking fro good middle eastern food.

sNCrhIZBGhuGLYsPax9vHw.text: The Kofte is delicious, the seabass is to die for and the desert menu is sophisticated. Go go go...

4Gc5ZCpPpdL-YXcRfjHrcQ.text: Excellent food. We are ate here two nights in a row. Great price a bit crowded but that's ok.

V3akNLNlb0Wv-gNFElJ3jA.text: Very impressed with the quality of food. Nice ambiance, definitely a good place to go have a conversation while enjoying quality Mediterranean cuisine. The only gotcha - the Turkish wine on the wine list is a bit of a gamble. But the baklava was superb!

how_CguityXyIN7mH24wNQ.text: I was seated right away, received great service from moment I was seated. The falafel was a wonderful appetizer and the cod was excellent. Can't wait to go back.

lqlq5XudJPoEapAEavh_mw.text: Simple, well prepared, delicious food. Atmosphere was manic. We had no reservation so we sat in the basement dining room. Cramped, kind of loud. While that wasn't much to my liking I can see that folks who like a festive and busy atmosphere flock to this place. Starters in 5 minutes, mains in 15 are guaranteed. This isn't fine dining except for the food. Prices were just fine and some surprisingly low.

5GWsKggdAmnu3Pkq_EwKYw.text: hidden gem that we stumbled upon. the seeing is a little tight, but the food is incredible, as is the friendly and attentive service.if I'm back in london, I'd go just for the Turkish coffee and Turkish delights.

Frk-GOUMxg8V1O5uQNpzaw.text: There is more to Turkish cuisine than the doner kebab.We arrived at 7pm without a reservation.  The wait was about an hour, so we walked off to find somewhere else.  Except, walking away we noticed that all of the outside tables were empty, although they had heat lamps.  So outside we sat.  And despite being a December night, it wasn't too cold at all.We shared a large plate of mezzes which were delicious (although grandma can make better).  Do warn them if you don't like corriander though.  For mains we shared a kebab stew, and stuffed aubergine.  The stuffed aubergine was a little meh...  Very homogenous, and a little plain.  If I were to eat a whole portion, I would have given up from boredom.  The stew though... amazing!  Perfectly spiced.  Rice was a little greasy though.Get the kunife (sp?) for dessert.  You won't regret it.

1AQKhKDqk6dKKEnauptHLA.text: Good spot. The food is very decent, the value OK. The place is somewhat small and fairly cozy. The service was pretty good, though I would guess this place imposes a No Smiling policy on its servers. A nice option for the area.

Iljl4OrZ5mmyd5ltSjRYTA.text: Impeccable. Gorgeous venue, gorgeous food, gorgeous  service. This is the jewel in the crown for us when in London, the quality of everything at Sofra is of a very high standard. We shared a Kunefe for desert which is a must have! Do yourself a favour and book a table by the window.

jwY8XXW4tC9LHaQhk80KcQ.text: Impeccable service and great food. The fish is at a reduced price after 9pm but still delicious.

NYfmbFSk8Ks0FO-VXAEXYw.text: Delicious food!  Pleasant dining room and staff. Prices are surprisingly inexpensive. The hummus is amazing and the bread is so fresh.  I seriously enjoyed the mezze tasting platter which included many of the spreads. I think I'm going back tonight.

rQ7ouQ5vTv6Elb4NWd2jCw.text: This place was recommended in our London Cheap Eats guide (a must for any Londoner on a budget). And ya know, even though it only has a 3 star rating, I was pleasantly surprised. They have a large dinner menu AND a great priced theatre menu. Our service was awesome. Our food was great. I'd come back if it weren't so out of the way. Luckily they have more than one location!

vb27Lk2m28aSVLg3j-sbRA.text: Another one of my favourite haunts that I use at lunchtimes at work and also in the evening as it is so good.  Turkish food doesn't need to mean queuing up at the kebab vans at twelve o'clock at night and asking for extra chilli sauce. This is authentique Turkish cuisine with an element of sophistication to it. Pop in for a quickie which consists of a drink, a main and as much bread as you like, which is ideal if you are at work or go in your own time for a leisurely and relaxing time with lots of exciting and exciting dishes to choose from. Fish, game, Scottish steak ? and the more expected lamb dishes along with vegetarian and also some healthy options make this a place for all tastes. To be honest, I love it here and don't go enough. Based in Mayfair it is only a hop, skip and a jump from Oxford st, Regent st, Bond st or Kensington and should be experienced. Good honest food, well priced with excellent Turkish hospitality.

photos.caption: Photo of Sofra - London, United Kingdom

EM9bce6pCDQgjdhCnwsjOg.text: It was just OK. My friend and I are on a diet so the set menu with loads of deep fried options... was not an option.My friend had the stuffed vine leaves and tabbuleh salad, while I had the lentil soup and nut salad. At £15 per person a la carte (including a bottle of water to share) I guess it's the usual fare for London, but I don't think it's good value and I doubt  I'll go back as Sofra used to be much better.We had to move to a different table as we were put next to the door (too draughty, it's cold out there!), and the new table was squashed in a corner next to a little old lady singing to herself (bless her!).The food was nice, but I wouldn't call this a pleasant dining experience so we left as soon as we cleaned our plates.

VdyQIm_77IfvATXJTmZAAA.text: Consistently good, attentive service and tasty food. Lots of seafood and vegetarian options, too, and most of which are actually somewhat healthy - quite a find in London, where chips seem to come with everything. They have a set menu and some deals inside the menu as well, which makes it more reasonable, although it's not too expensive to begin with. It would be a lot nicer to sit outside under the nice heat lamps if less people smoked, but not much can be done about that. They serve breakfast, too, which I still need to try!

VaCcTQVrUhUnCDbGTvH7WQ.text: First of all--yay for this little enclave of restaurants and pubs at Shephard Street.  There is a lot of good food and drink exploring to do.  Unfortunately Sofra didn't impress me.  I did like the charming and sophisticated host who was very friendly and helpful.  The setting here is a bit weird--there is a downstairs, an upstairs, outdoor seating, and then an odd small room where there are tables.  We ended up in this odd small room that demonstrated that anywhere they could throw a table, they would and they did without any ambiance and next to the stairs to their downstairs kitchen. Delicious complementary hummus arrived with olives which was tasty. It was one of those menus with just so many things on it that it was overwhelming.   I ordered the spicy monkfish in coconut cream sauce with ginger--I know, doesn't it sound so good?  But it just wasn't.  No spice, sauce was eh, and the fish was a bit chewy.  My table had seabass and moussaka of which by the looks of their dishes I just wasn't blown away.  It is fine, but nothing extraordinary.  Next time I think I'd stick to the mezze platter and get the authentic food--probably a better bet.  But if I am in that area again, I have a hunch there are better options...

mNYPfzm8FK17cEcu_2UztA.text: Tried Sofra for the 2nd time and our experience was not good.  The waiter apparently was new and did not know the menu.  The food brought to our table was not what we ordered.  Food was OK, but not worth the hassle.  Overall I think we will not be going back to Sofra.

z3uCRPTnTOcw0x5VtwrCHQ.text: I have never tried Sofra restaurants before and went for lunch last week with a colleague. I was pleasantly surprised. The food was gorgeous, we ordered the hous special with 12 different dishes which I highly recommend. The service was great and the staff was very friendly. The 4 stars only come from the fact that we were charged an additional £4.50 to the bill for "covers" on top of service charge - similar to some places in Italy where you pay for the right to sit and have cutlery! Or...maybe it was for the fact that they welcome you with olives. Either way I don't mind as the place is a definite must-try, but it would be nice to be told!

otR0gtY43Rt_mjlPhu2gmg.text: Good quality full English, very reasonably priced with excellent ingredients - Cumberland sausage, full size chunky rashers of bacon and nicely cooked egg. Coffee is filter, which always tastes a bit weak but is probably much better for you. If you go for the omelette or scrambled versions, specify well done or might be very lightly cooked, which might be a bit offputting. Very friendly and attentive staff - good value - recommended.

R0MW0rU17olvER2R2QMbgA.text: Very cute. Decent food. Worth a stop. Nothing special but seems solid.

xVlO4EYDFbFs_k5jccV1zw.text: Thought this was a good place for breakfast and I found the service good.The summer berry pancakes and menemen (eggs with green peppers on brioche) were delicious and the price was reasonable.  I'd recommend this place.

2b95WdmQ8bAxyFELPzE7Sw.text: The perfect way to start the evening.  The service was friendly and gentle--not pushy or overly attentive.  The food was outstanding with beautiful flavors that burst with joy with each bite.

0dbVYxN3Xy168nF1OKsfcQ.text: Food is decent.  The Brexit menu is a good value, starting a plate of sample of many appetizers, follow by the main course.  I think just the appetizer is adequate, with the bread and hummus they will fill you up.

Z1un0oKD8SAFf4V51xh91Q.text: Just a walk up while in London and was pleasantly surprised with the warm welcome and variety of the menu. Had the Lamb Tangine and it was outstanding. Quaint. Well priced. Excellent service. Exceeded expectations.

ZsDwXsHKNpFSb8OPl74Y-Q.text: Get the Brexit menu! Just £14 or so for 7 different mezzes and a main. Great deal!The food was all delicious. The interior is a bit trippy with all the mirrors so don't go if you don't like the sight of yourself eating!

yZVksGIb16bt8KVS607nUQ.text: What a wonderful and refreshing restaurant. Our waiter Alex was impeccable and very caring. The food was wonderful and the prices decent. Our favorite part was dessert. Highly recommend the Kadaifi with clotted cream and warm syrup to pour on top along with a Turkish coffee. Definitely one of my top London favorites, Situated in a lovely neighborhood that's very walkable. I will go again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sofra - London, United Kingdom

8A2Q7TBu5CJQJsP7bikE5w.text: Just arrived yesterday, went with the family to this Turkish restaurant, really excellent, clean and welcoming.Food was great, liver fantastic, lamp leg was great " Soo Tender"

cRJEz_XFWk8g_HM2ynoiLw.text: I have been to Sofra several times while staying in London. Tucked in a beautiful Mayfair neighborhood, Sofra offers traditional Turkish far. While this is not a trendy restaurant you will find promoted to tourists, it is a great spot for dinner. We initially found Sofra about 10 years ago while staying in a hotel down the street. The restaurant is always packed, so I highly recommend making a reservation.  Service is quick and friendly.

gc9e9CEbzvxUZsTN4FLbyQ.text: A nice little Turkish restaurant that's trying hard to please. When we arrived we were greeted by a somewhat flustered maitre'd. I think another large party had arrived just before us so we had to wait for a while to get our orders in. However after that little delay everything was very pleasing. I had the chargrilled lamb and beef and it was delicious. For desert I went with the homemade ice cream and was surprised at how rich and creamy it was.

aiUDYC0PDN5S88JMwG4EZA.text: I had dinner there last night. They offered a table in downstair which I didn't like. We ordered Iskendar kabab and Tanzhin. Kabab wasn't tasty and even worse  the lamb they used in tanzhin was very cold. They just warmed a piece of freeze lamb and added some spico.Never will go.

CJW-wxa2NDzUhl-zrwvBfg.text: Stumbled on this place. Nice outdoor dining in Mayfair. Service a solid 5, very attentive but not overbearing and fast, even by American standards. Spanakopita (they call it something else since it's a Turkish restaurant) was a 5, Tabouleh only a 3, homemade hummus also a 5, haloumi was only a 3. My son ordered the ground lamb with rice. He gave it a 3 to 4. The meat was very good but the rest was sort of bland.

3b5fG_xWKq1E3xBqZiUArg.text: We really wanted to go out for dinner with friends and we decided to go to the centre since it would be the easiest for all and taking into account that there were various culinary difference and requirements we decided to try a Turkish restaurant. So we ended up here.The place itself is easy to find and outside looks very upmarket. It is generally a white table cloth restaurant frequented by mostly people of the upper age limit. I found that the restaurant although is not bad the table are really cramped and you sit very close to your neighbour to the point you can hear the conversation. Food wise the quality was amazing but the menu was very restricted to the main dishes you can find almost in all Turkish restaurants. The main Turkish courses where very restricted but there was a good choice of BBQ meats. Deserts were also quite westernised. Wine menu was interesting consisting mostly of French and some Italian wines and a few Turkish ones. Now as i am really a fun of Turkish wines i was very disappointed not to find a bigger selection of Turkish ones.In general i got the feeling that this restaurant although not a bad choice is moslty targetting older local people and has given an extra care in westernising thei menu. Overall a good choice if you want to have an introduction to Turkish cuisine and/or you want to do it on the upper limit of the budget.

KURTHU1yEVA_Qr7VGhXHsw.text: The reviews are incredibly misleading. Let's start at the beginning. The waiter was a 1 out of ten, and I'm being generous. He was simply uncaring and lousy. He forgot the wine, the bread, the menus, to ask for drinks, etc..... The couple who sat next to us left after 10 minutes once they recognized the service level. The food was a 5 out of 10. Fine but nothing better than average. The bottle of Sauvignon blanc was served room temperature. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere. Lastly, I tend not to write bad reviews on Yelp. This one was our worst meal in London by far, and it needed to be called out.

5xxc9-0E-M67bYHRK8Q3ug.text: This is my second time eating here on my annual trips to London.  Last year in 2016, my experience was better all around than this year, but it is a tasty change from the many Italian eateries and pub food.  For the most recent visit, I'd give a 4+ star for food and a 2 star for service.  We arrived for an early dinner and it was clear that they were interested in turning our table as soon as possible.  The restaurant is very deliberate in getting food out promptly which is to be commended but our service was absent and then rushed as food was served.  I was a bit embarrassed to have introduced my extended family to what was such a great experience for me last time.  The ambiance and feel is rather nice on the quiet streets of Mayfair.  I feel like I will give it another try on my next trip based on the food alone and let the service dictate if I'll return any more.

NEdsBGh49kt9sabve6EoOA.text: The food here is second to none. Our extremely polite waiter recommend the tasting menu and it was absolutely wonderful. Great ambiance. Super lucky to have stumbled upon this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Sofra - London, United Kingdom

jMCEivWYJ8l3lTNIIKeDZg.text: Love this place! Excellent service. My waiter made some suggestions for a combo appetizer and for the trio mixed grill main. Excellent food. I got the warm kunefeh for dessert. BOMB! I enjoyed my dinner so much that i wanted to go back the next day. I made the mistake of going to a french place & saw a mouse. So i left and came here for a repeat! On a side note, their breakfast menu looked good too! Definitely returning on my next stay in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Sofra - London, United Kingdom. Warm kunefeh! Yummaaaay!
Photo of Sofra - London, United Kingdom. Trio chargrilled combo. Hummus, olives, & bread complimentary! And ayran! Mmm!

cXcxtHjNNSuQYiEw3-T53g.text: Place is very cozy, upscale and waitress was very friendly and helpful. She knew the menu and made wonderful suggestions. She was on point! Desserts looked fantastic food tested great definitely a must have. It is a little bit pricey but you definitely worth every euro.  Five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Sofra - London, United Kingdom. Wagyu rib eye 8oz steak. Yummy

vuCpkKXfrwLYeKCZog34oQ.text: Our UK partner swears by this place. He loves if there's a line to get in, the staff pour you a free glass of wine while you wait for a table. Mains are pretty simple affairs. The mackerel was nothing to write home about. Great value and variety in the pre-theater menu. Good bread basket. I really liked the app sampler plate. The kunefe dessert was okay, like a baklava with a self-administered morphine drip. Add the gooey syrup to taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Sofra - London, United Kingdom. Kunefe
Photo of Sofra - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sofra - London, United Kingdom

UTDjbkgHPuG27Dn6Psy8kQ.text: I love Sofra!! They seated us without a reservation even though they were jam crowded! Excellent Greek food and a nice waitstaff. I had the lamb skewers and my boyfriend had a gyro type thing. Soda was expensive with no refills but hey! It's London and in Mayfair no less!! Try it! You'll like it!

photos.caption: Photo of Sofra - London, United Kingdom

2BL2x7enXAag3wA6rp1RbA.text: We had an amazing dinner and fantastic service tonight. We stumbled upon this restaurant late on Sunday evening and had a large group of 9. Murat, who ended up being our server, saw us out front looking at the menu. Even though it was late he still welcomed us in. He gave us a spacious table and wonderful guidance on items. He brought so much delicious food to us and made us feel so at home. It was a fantastic and memorable night.  Excellent service and food!

sSPN2WtNbQYm0K8vWZ7rug.text: Such a shame, I love Sofra! I've been to a few of the restaurants around London and always had a good time. This one I went to with a couple of friends to comiserate losing one of them to the cheaper yet more depressing location of South Manchester. And I should know, that's where I grew up!We had hummus, flatbreads, halloumi and spinach & feta parcels to start - very tasty, the halloumi had a touch of chilli to spice up the palette. I loved the parcels too, nice and crispy outside (ironically a touch too much cheese and not enough spinach).Then to the mains, lamb tagine for me and chargrilled lamb for the others. The Tagine was not what I expected, a nice sweetness from the apricots and raisins, but the lamb was on the bone, fatty and not in a tagine. The couscous was dry as well. The others had lamb that seemed ok. The main issue however was the service - rude, brisk and the waiters almost dropped the food on us whilst looking to seem like it was our fault. The restaurant downstairs was dirty as well, very small and cramped with a heater in the corner that basically roasted us all.Not the best Sofra by anyone's standards
